This is the test plan and report for
\textbf{ M1M3 Thermal Control System Verification Testing on Level 3.},
an LSST milestone pertaining to the Data Management Subsystem.\\
This document is based on content automatically extracted from the Jira test database on \docDate.
The most recent change to the document repository was on \vcsDate.
}


\maketitle

\section{Introduction}
\label{sect:intro}


\subsection{Objectives}
\label{sect:objectives}

 The goal of this Test Plan is to verify all the M1M3 Thermal System
requirements that can be Tested with the M1M3 Cell and the Surrogate on
Level\_3.



\subsection{System Overview}
\label{sect:systemoverview}

 The M1M3 assembly refers to the Primary and Tertiary telescope mirror,
its support system, the mirror cell, the M1M3 Mirror (or surrogate
Mirror), and the Thermal Control System. The last-mentioned System
consists of several blower nozzles, thermal heat exchangers, cooling
Fans, thermal sensors, a water/glycol mixture coolant system, glycol
pump and control electronics.


\subsection{Document Overview}
\label{sect:docoverview}

This document was generated from Jira, obtaining the relevant information from the
\href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/secure/Tests.jspa\#/testPlan/LVV-P93}{LVV-P93}
~Jira Test Plan and related Test Cycles (
\href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/secure/Tests.jspa\#/testCycle/LVV-C185}{LVV-C185}
\href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/secure/Tests.jspa\#/testCycle/LVV-C194}{LVV-C194}
\href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/secure/Tests.jspa\#/testCycle/LVV-C195}{LVV-C195}
).

Section \ref{sect:intro} provides an overview of the test campaign, the system under test (\product{}),
the applicable documentation, and explains how this document is organized.
Section \ref{sect:testplan} provides additional information about the test plan, like for example the configuration
used for this test or related documentation.
Section \ref{sect:personnel} describes the necessary roles and lists the individuals assigned to them.

Section \ref{sect:overview} provides a summary of the test results, including an overview in Table \ref{table:summary},
an overall assessment statement and suggestions for possible improvements.
Section \ref{sect:detailedtestresults} provides detailed results for each step in each test case.

The current status of test plan \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/secure/Tests.jspa\#/testPlan/LVV-P93}{LVV-P93} in Jira is \textbf{ Draft }.

\newpage
\section{Test Plan Details}
\label{sect:testplan}


\subsection{Data Collection}

  Observing is not required for this test campaign.

\subsection{Verification Environment}
\label{sect:hwconf}
  The M1M3 Thermal Control System will be first verified with the Mirror
Cell + Subrogated Mirror on the 3rd floor of the Summit Facility. Then,
once the coated M1M3 Mirror has been installed in the mirror cell, this
Mirror system, together with its Thermal System, will be installed and
verified on the TMA (Telescope Mount Assembly).

  \subsection{Entry Criteria}
  To run these tests, the following criteria must be met first:\\

\begin{itemize}
\tightlist
\item
  All the M1M3 Hazard Tickets and their Mitigations must be in VERIFIED
  Status.
\item
  All utilities and electrical connections are hooked up and allow the
  M1M3 to be powered on and controlled.
\item
  The EFD must be set up to be able to store events and telemetry data.
\item
  Requires the surrogate mirror to be installed in the M1M3 mirror cell
  before performing the First Verification Cycle.
\item
  Requires the coated mirror to be installed in the M1M3 mirror cell and
  installed on the TMA before performing the Second Verification Cycle.
\end{itemize}

  \subsection{Exit Criteria}
  For this event to be considered complete, the following criteria must be
met:

\begin{itemize}
\tightlist
\item
  Raw test data, events, and telemetry must be stored in the M1M3 Summit
  EFD.
\item
  All test data has been analyzed and post-processed.
\item
  All test steps have been stated in the Jira Test Cases within this
  Test Plan and actual results populated as required.
\item
  A summary of the results of the test campaign has been captured in the
  Overall Assessment and Recommended Improvements fields of this Test
  Plan
\item
  A link to the verification artifacts used to produce the summary of
  results has been populated in the Verification Artifacts field of this
  Test Plan
\item
  Any failures have been captured in the
  \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/projects/FRACAS/issues/}{FRACAS}
  project
\end{itemize}


\subsection{Related Documentation}


No additional documentation provided.


\subsection{PMCS Activity}

Primavera milestones related to the test campaign:
\begin{itemize}
\item None
\end{itemize}

\subsection{Test Cycle LVV-C185 }

Open test cycle {\it \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/secure/Tests.jspa#/testrun/LVV-C185}{M1M3 Thermal Control System Verification on Level 3.}} in Jira.

Test Cycle name: M1M3 Thermal Control System Verification on Level 3.\\
Status: Not Executed

This preliminary Test Cycle aims to TEST all the M1M3 Thermal Control
System requirements that can be performed on Level\_3 with the M1M3 Cell
+ Surrogate Mirror configuration.

\subsubsection{Test Cases in LVV-C185 Test Cycle}

\paragraph{ LVV-T2401 - M1M3 Self-Heat Removal Methods Verification on Level\_3 }\mbox{}\\

Version \textbf{1}.
Open  \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/secure/Tests.jspa#/testCase/LVV-T2401}{\textit{ LVV-T2401 } }
test case in Jira.

The main purpose of this Test Case is to verify the M1M3 Thermal System
can remove the total Heat Load generated by the Cell's active components
such as the FCU and the Recirculation Pump.\\[2\baselineskip]This Test
Case Verifies that the following specific requirements should be met:\\

\begin{itemize}
\tightlist
\item
  That the self-released heat shall be absorbed by the thermal Coolant
  system itself and evacuated from the mirror cell.
\item
  The whole M1M3 mirror thermal system must dissipate \textasciitilde{}
  10.4 kW of heat in total.
\item
  And that the self-heat removal load must specifically include the
  power/heat produced by the fans/blower and the recirculation pump.
\end{itemize}

\paragraph{ LVV-T2543 - M1M3 Control System Automatic Mode GUI Requirements Test on Level\_3 }\mbox{}\\

Version \textbf{1}.
Open  \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/secure/Tests.jspa#/testCase/LVV-T2543}{\textit{ LVV-T2543 } }
test case in Jira.

The aim of this Test Case is to verify all the Requirements related to
the Automatic Control Mode of the Thermal System:\\

\begin{itemize}
\tightlist
\item
  Change the Blower Speed, Mixing valve offset, the Pump speed, and its
  operational mode.
\item
  And also validate that the Thermal System and its associated
  controller devices must operate automatically in \textbf{Automatic
  Mode} while Operating/Observing without the interaction of any
  technical Staff.
\end{itemize}

\textbf{ Preconditions}:\\


Execution status: {\bf Not Executed }

Final comment:\\


Detailed steps results:

 Description \\

\href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/browse/LVV-18903}{LTS-89-REQ-0112-V-01}:
Automatic Mode Operations\\

\begin{itemize}
\tightlist
\item
  Launch the Engineering Thermal System GUI ``M1M3TSGUI.py''.
\item
  Enable the Automatic Mode.
\item
  Energize/de-energize the system
\item
  Energize/de-energize the significant subsystems (blower assemblies and
  recirculation loop)
\item
  Change the target temperature.
\item
  Change the blower speed.
\item
  Change the recirculation pump speed.
\item
  Change the recirculation pump operation mode.
\item
  Change the mixing valve offset.
\end{itemize}

\paragraph{ LVV-T2524 - M1M3 Thermal System Cooling and Heating Rate Test on Level\_3 }\mbox{}\\

Version \textbf{1}.
Open  \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/secure/Tests.jspa#/testCase/LVV-T2524}{\textit{ LVV-T2524 } }
test case in Jira.

This Test Case will aim to verify that the Thermal System can regulate,
control, and adjust the cooling and heating capacity of the Mirror Cell
(with the real Mirror?) while the surrounding ambient temperature change
with time.\\[2\baselineskip]This Test Case Verifies that once it has
been performed, the following specific requirements should be met:

\begin{itemize}
\tightlist
\item
  The measured M1M3 mirror temperature must be 1.0°C lower than the
  ambient temperature inside the enclosure, with a resolution of 0.1°C,
  at any time during the time scale of the Test.
\item
  That the measured Cooling rate of the M1M3 mirror must be
  \textgreater{}= 0.7 °C.
\item
  The measured Thermal Heat rate of the M1M3 mirror must be
  \textgreater{}= 2.0 °C/hour.
\end{itemize}

\textbf{ Preconditions}:\\


Execution status: {\bf Not Executed }

Final comment:\\

\paragraph{ LVV-T2414 - M1M3 Interlock System Interface Test on Level\_3 }\mbox{}\\

Version \textbf{1}.
Open  \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/secure/Tests.jspa#/testCase/LVV-T2414}{\textit{ LVV-T2414 } }
test case in Jira.

The aim of this Test case is to verify that the M1M3 Interlock System
(IS) activates if a Leak, open Cell door, or an Emergency e-stop has
been detected/enabled.\\[2\baselineskip]The following 5x specific
requirements will be verified during this Test Case:

\begin{itemize}
\tightlist
\item
  \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/browse/LVV-18907}{LTS-89-REQ-0114-V-01}:
  Heartbeat
\item
  \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/browse/LVV-18905}{LTS-89-REQ-0116-V-01}:
  Door Open Detection
\item
  \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/browse/LVV-18904}{LTS-89-REQ-0115-V-01}:
  Leak Detection
\item
  \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/browse/LVV-18906}{LTS-89-REQ-0117-V-01}:
  Emergency Stop
\item
  \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/browse/LVV-18908}{LTS-89-REQ-0118-V-01}:
  Interlock Override
\end{itemize}

\textbf{Discussion:}\\
{This is a pending Test Case where before continuing with its
description, a GIS meeting with Austin, Felipe, and Franco needs to be
settled in order to discuss the Final implementation of these M1M3 IS
and how the Verification of this Test Case will be performed.}

\textbf{ Preconditions}:\\


Execution status: {\bf Not Executed }

Final comment:\\


Detailed steps results:

\begin{tabular}{p{2cm}p{14cm}}
\toprule
Step 1 & Step Execution Status: \textbf{ Not Executed } \\ \hline
\end{tabular}
 Description \\

\paragraph{ LVV-T2406 - M1M3 Air Flow throw Nozzle Test on Level\_3 }\mbox{}\\

Version \textbf{1}.
Open  \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/secure/Tests.jspa#/testCase/LVV-T2406}{\textit{ LVV-T2406 } }
test case in Jira.

This Test Case aims to verify that the implemented Air Flow
recirculation system between the M1M3 Mirror and Cell can achieve the
temperature Specification imposed on the Mirror by adjusting the air
flowing through each Nozzle and the FCU. This Test will be first
implemented and verified on a specially designed Test Bench and later on
the M1M3 complete system.\\[2\baselineskip]The following 2x specific
requirements will be verified with this Test Case:

\begin{itemize}
\tightlist
\item
  \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/browse/LVV-11350}{LTS-89-REQ-0061-V-01}:
  Air Flow Nozzles Height Adjustment
\item
  \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/browse/LVV-11345}{LTS-89-REQ-0059-V-01}:
  Air Flow Speed Variability
\end{itemize}

update. There are some technical descriptions of the Test Stand to test
the Nozzles head position inside the mirror Cell in the ``M1M3 Mirror
Thermal Control System -- Fan Coil Unit Testing Update'' presentation
from August 13, 2018, that it can be found in
DocuShare.}\\[2\baselineskip]

\paragraph{ LVV-T2405 - M1M3 Operational Safety Test on Level\_3 }\mbox{}\\

Version \textbf{1}.
Open  \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/secure/Tests.jspa#/testCase/LVV-T2405}{\textit{ LVV-T2405 } }
test case in Jira.

The Objective of this Test Case will be to verify that the implemented
M1M3 Thermal Safety System must lower the Mirror and shut down the
Glycol and Air pumping system in case of a Leak.\\[2\baselineskip]The
following 3x specific requirements will be verified with this Test Case:

\begin{itemize}
\tightlist
\item
  ~Automatic Leak Detection System =\textgreater{} Leak Alarm enables
  correctly
\item
  The Mirror Cell Assembly Protection activates =\textgreater{} It Lower
  the Mirror.
\item
  And then, it will follow the Automatic Shutdown of the Complete
  thermal System (Mixing Valve, Recirculation Pump, FCU, etc.).
\end{itemize}

\paragraph{ LVV-T2394 - M1M3 Coolant System Operational Test on Level\_3 }\mbox{}\\

Version \textbf{1}.
Open  \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/secure/Tests.jspa#/testCase/LVV-T2394}{\textit{ LVV-T2394 } }
test case in Jira.

This Test Case aims to verify M1M3 Coolant System loop can be closed and
control the Mirror Cell temperature (and it Mirror?) and also check the
functionality of its Pump and Mixing Valve
sub-components.\\[2\baselineskip]The following 4x coolant system
specific requirements verifications that must be tested here are:\\

\begin{itemize}
\tightlist
\item
  \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/browse/LVV-11390}{}\href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/browse/LVV-11390}{}The
  coolant temperature must be maintained between 5 and 10 deg C below
  ambient
  temperature.\href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/browse/LVV-18909}{}
\item
  Check/confirm that the installed Pump must work with the following two
  operating modes:

  \begin{itemize}
  \tightlist
  \item
    Constant speed: The pump operates at a constant speed through the
    automatic system or the GUI.~
  \item
    Variable speed: The pump operates on a speed proportional to the
    difference between the mean mirror temperature and the target
    temperature. The system provides all the parameters necessary to
    tune the system for this mode.
  \end{itemize}
\item
  ~The metering valve must keep the cooling fluid temperature relative
  to the target temperature within +/-0.5 °C of a specified offset
  setting below the target temperature (typically 1degC below this
  target temp).\href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/browse/LVV-18897}{}
\item
  Check/confirm that the installed Mixing Valve must work using two
  operational modes.

  \begin{itemize}
  \tightlist
  \item
    Constant offset: The mixing value operates at a constant temperature
    offset provided through the GUI.
  \item
    Variable offset: The mixing valve operates on a temperature offset
    proportional to the difference between the mean mirror temperature
    and the target temperature. For this mode, the system provides all
    the parameters necessary to tune the system.
  \end{itemize}
\end{itemize}

{\\
}

\textbf{ Preconditions}:\\


Execution status: {\bf Not Executed }

Final comment:\\


Detailed steps results:

\begin{tabular}{p{2cm}p{14cm}}
\toprule
Step 1 & Step Execution Status: \textbf{ Not Executed } \\ \hline
\end{tabular}
 Description \\
{\footnotesize

}
\hdashrule[0.5ex]{\textwidth}{1pt}{3mm}
  Expected Result \\
{\footnotesize

}
\hdashrule[0.5ex]{\textwidth}{1pt}{3mm}
  Actual Result \\
{\footnotesize

Status: Not Executed

The main task of this Test Cycle aims to gather all the information
(documentation, photographs, etc.) and perform Analysis work
(calculations, estimations, etc.) that the M1M3 Thermal Control System
requires while the Cell is located on Level\_3.~

\paragraph{ LVV-T2408 - M1M3 Reliability \& Maintainability Demonstration on Level\_3 }\mbox{}\\

Version \textbf{1}.
Open  \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/secure/Tests.jspa#/testCase/LVV-T2408}{\textit{ LVV-T2408 } }
test case in Jira.

Demonstrate that replacing an onboard blower assembly (FCU) or any other
cooling system equipment in the M1M3 mirror thermal system shall require
less than 3 hours to be performed.

\textbf{ Preconditions}:\\
Prior to the execution of this test case, the following must be
completed:\\

\begin{enumerate}
\tightlist
\item
  All M1M3 Systems installed + Surrogate (it does not need the real
  mirror).
\item
  All M1M3 Systems can be operated but at the time of the replacement,
  they must be disabled.~
\item
  The M1M3 mirror system is in passive mode and the Surrogate is resting
  on the static supports.
\item
  The M1M3 mirror positioning system is operational and the outputs are
  being recorded.
\item
  M1M3 Thermal Control system is current and in maintenance configured
  mode for this test.
\item
  All test data is being recorded to the Engineering Facility Database
  EFD
\end{enumerate}

\paragraph{ LVV-T2395 - M1M3 Coolant System Inspections and Analysis }\mbox{}\\

Version \textbf{1}.
Open  \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/secure/Tests.jspa#/testCase/LVV-T2395}{\textit{ LVV-T2395 } }
test case in Jira.

This Test Inspection/Analysis aims to verify that the following 4x M1M3
Coolant System requirements will be met by the technical documentation
being attached with this test Case:\\

\begin{itemize}
\tightlist
\item
  Check that all the installed Plumbing materials are made of
  corrosion-resistant materials, stainless steel, copper, or polymers
  approved by LSST PO.
\item
  \textbf{~}Using the data provided by the manufacturer, check and
  validate that the flow rate to each blower assembly (fan coil unit) is
  nominally identical, and follows the design.
\item
  Confirm that The Mirror thermal control system MUST have installed a
  Metering Valve (three-way mixing valve) and a Recirculation Pump to
  control the temperature of the glycol/water cooling loop.
\item
  \textbf{~}By checking the installed Pump Manufacturer Datasheet,
  confirm that the recirculation system must have the following
  properties:
\end{itemize}

~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ 1. Variable frequency drive to vary and control the pump
speed.\\
\hspace*{0.333em} ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ 2. Be of a centripetal type and not a
reciprocating type.\\
\hspace*{0.333em} ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ 3. Thermally enclosed and with heat removed
by the thermal mirror system.\\
\hspace*{0.333em} ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ 4. Vibration isolated with isolation mounts
and flexible hose attachments.

\textbf{ Preconditions}:\\


Execution status: {\bf Not Executed }

Final comment:\\

Open  \href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/secure/Tests.jspa#/testCase/LVV-T2517}{\textit{ LVV-T2517 } }
test case in Jira.

\href{https://jira.lsstcorp.org/browse/LVV-11702}{\textbf{LTS-89-REQ-0031-V-01}}\textbf{:
Total Heat / Cooling Capacity.~}Verify that the thermal mirror system
must have the capacity to meet:\\

\begin{itemize}
\tightlist
\item
  the pre-cooling, heating rate, and cooling rates, including the mass
  of the borosilicate mirror, steel mirror cell, invar spreaders,
  aluminum actuators, steel static supports, and steel hardpoints.~
\item
  In addition, it shall remove the heat produced by itself, the mirror
  support system, the fan coil units, and all electronics.
\end{itemize}

Execution status: {\bf Not Executed }
